Staff 1 (S1) was present and was trying to de-escalate the situation between them. C1 had already called 911 before S1 contacted the paramedics after C2 threw a can of aerosol at C1's stomach. Statements indicated that there had been no prior incidents between C1 and C2. Following this incident, C2 was removed from the home for violating the participant manual. The Department has decided that the allegation is unsubstantiated but if additional information is received this complaint can be amended and the finding can be changed. There are no deficiencies to be cited at this time. Exit interview was conducted and a copy of this report will be emailed to the Facility Administrator.

narrative:
On 7/22/2025, at 1:00PM Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Nancy O’Connell made an unannounced visit to the above-listed facility for Case Management- deficiency inspection. LPA met with Jose Alvarado, House Parent (HP1) who granted access to the facility. The facility is licensed to care for a capacity of 74 Non-minor Dependents. LPA requested and obtained a copy of the LIC500 along with the client roster for Department records. On 6/11/2025, LPA Nancy O’Connell and Licensing Program Manager (LPM), Kevin Sauk received an email from the facility Interim Board President (BP), Lorie Vos, communicating that the facility no longer has a Facility Administrator (FA), effective 6/11/25. LPM Sauk immediately requested additional information related to a plan for proposed coverage while a new FA is hired and/or trained. On 6/16/25, the BP submitted a “transition plan” that included proposed coverage for an interim FA to be completed by HP1. LPA O’Connell conducted a thorough review of the submitted documents for HP1. Based on category specific regulations listed in California Code Regulation, TITLE 22, DIVISION 6, CHAPTERS 1 and 7, General Licensing Regulation, the Facility Administrator must meet education and/or experiential requirements and have the knowledge of the requirements for providing the type of care and supervision needed by clients…”, and “…the ability to comply with applicable law and regulation.” Additionally, all Transitional Housing Placement Program (THPP) administrators must complete additional training related to sexual and reproductive rights of children in fostercare. Based on review of HP1’s documentation along with an interview of HP1, there is no previous supervisor work history of oversight of regulatory responsibilities within a position previously held. Further, HP1 does not currently meet training requirements related to sexual reproductive health rights for THPP administrators. Due to these reasons, the Department was unable to approve HP1 as an interim FA for the facility.

Further, LPA O’Connell conducted a review of records for clients in care for C1, C2, C3, C4 , C5 and C6 (See Confidential names list, dated 7/22/25, for names). LPA O’Connell reviewed intake documents along with Needs and Services Plans(NSP), and verified that NSP documents are required to be completed monthly. LPA found the following: C1- there is 1/17 NSPs completed and signed since admission. C2- there were 0/10 NSPs on file since admission. C3- there were 0/3 NSPs on file since admission. C4- there were 0 NSPs due at the time of inspection and 0 on file. C5- there were 0/7 NSPs on file since admission. C6-there is 1/8 NSPs on file and signed since admission. Upon interview. HP1 reported that he does not have knowledge of the former Administrator's process for completion of NSPs. HP1 was informed of regulatory requirement, which he agreed to and acknowledged. Per California Code Regulation, TITLE 22, DIVISION 6, CHAPTERS 1 and 7, General Licensing Regulation, there are two deficiencies to be cited at this time.See LIC809D for details. Exit Interview was conducted with staff, and a copy of this report was provided to the facility via email.

On the above date, a virtual component II orientation is conducted by LPA (Licensing Program Analyst) Lisa Slusher with Administrator and Board member Margaret Mungai. LPA forwarded letter with requested corrections on 8/18/21. Corrections (620 Pages) were submitted on 8/22. LPA is reviewing corrections at this time. Discussed Fingerprinting and the Guardian system, and the need for the agency to create an account. Agency will in the meantime send associations for appropriate staff to this LPA, and will have staff fingerprint if required. Discussed Foster Care Rates Status. Pre-licensing inspection tentatively scheduled for 9/2/21 at the Facility in Merced, CA.

On the above date, Licensing Program Analysts Eduardo Barragan and Lisa Slusher travelled to the CTC THP + NMD office in Merced CA . LPAs were met by Administrator Margaret Mungai, for the purpose of a scheduled pre-licensing inspection for an initial licensure for a THP + NMD program.. A general overview of their program and a tour of the facility was provided. This facility has a reception area, waiting area, and office space for staff. Observed fixtures and furniture, equipment and supplies necessary for this operation. Also observed locked cabinets for client and staff files in order to ensure confidentiality and a fully stocked first aid kit. Discussed daily ongoing functions including incident reports. Initial incident reports are to be submitted by the next working day to CCLFresnoIncidents@dss,ca,gov. A full report shall follow within 7 days. There is sample confidential space for meeting with clients on an as needed basis. Agency has received Administrative approval to manage background clearances through Guardian, and will ensure that all staff are appropriately cleared and associated prior to presence in the facility. Agency has contacted the FCARB (Foster Care Rates and Audits Bureau) about obtaining funding. Once licensed, LPA will forward information to FCARB. LPAs observed staff files and sample participant files. The above licensee is recommended for licensure on this date as a THP+NMD serving clients age 18-21 in Merced county and other counties within a two hour radius, pending approval of program Statement updates. . On a quarterly basis, facility is to submit a roster of THP+NMD clients that includes client names, dates of birth, county worker and current address of placement as well as a current LIC 500.

Discussed possible exception for a Social Work Supervisor/Social Worker Supervisor. Agency will send transcripts (Masters and Doctorate) for SWS as well as documentation of requirements for becoming a registered addiction specialist along with the exception request for regulation sections 86065.2 (Social Worker Supervisor) and 86065.3 (Social Work).

On this date, an unannounced annual inspection is conducted by Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Rachel Bruce who was met at the facility by Executive Director, Margaret Numgai and Office Manager Carolyne Njogu. The agency currently has no clients but maintains a 5 bed facility at 547 Childs Ave, Merced, CA. Employed currently is one social worker, two LCSW, a social worker intern, a volunteer who maintains the facility, Office Manager, CEO and Executive Director. Staff interviews conducted during visit. A general overview of their program and a tour of the facility was provided. This facility has a reception area, waiting area, and office space for staff. LPA Bruce observed fixtures and furniture, equipment and supplies necessary for this operation. Also observed locked cabinets for client and staff files in order to ensure confidentiality. When living units are occupied, inspections will be conducted monthly to ensure the facility is meeting required guidelines. Regardless of occupancy, the facility will ensure that firearms or other weapons are not stored in THP living units and that fire extinguishers and carbon monoxide detectors are in proper working order. There are no participant files to review on this date. Paid staff and volunteer files were reviewed. No citations issued at today's visit. A review of personnel records on this date indicates that facility personnel are appropriately fingerprint cleared. Exit interview conducted with Margaret Numgai, and a copy of this report along with appeal rights was provided to the agency.

On this date, an unannounced annual inspection was conducted by Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Brinae Pointer who was met at the facility by Office Manager Carolyne Njogu. LPA was informed by the staff of them being an Enhanced Care Management Community Support facility, and the THPP+NMD having no clients at the time. LPA was informed by staff of Director Margaret Mungai, being more capable of answering any questions related to the THPP, and they would be arriving to the facility in the next 15-30 minutes. Director Margaret arrived at 11:50AM. The agency currently has no clients but is currently seeking grants in efforts of building housing on the previously acquired land. The Director reports there have been no clients in care for more than a year. Director reports they have since written to CDSS to report the program is not closed, but will house youth when they have a facility. Currently, there are no staff employed to operate the facility, due to there being no facility or youth housed by the agency. A general overview of their program and a tour of the facility was provided. This facility has a reception area, waiting area, and office space for staff. LPA Pointer observed fixtures and furniture, equipment and supplies necessary for this operation. LPA also observed locked cabinets for client and staff files in order to ensure confidentiality. Employed currently is the Office Manager and Director. There are no participant files to review on this date. Directors files were reviewed on this date indicating that personnel are appropriately fingerprint cleared. Director noted they will provide proof of 1st aide/ CPR renewal completion to LPA via email. Staff interviews conducted during visit. There are no deficiencies cited upon the conclusion of this inspection.

Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Monica Pavia made an announced prelicensing inspection, on above date. LPA met with applicant, Vanessa Russell and toured the office building. The applicant is applying for a Transitional Housing Placement Program (THPP) license. The office has sufficient space for confidential meetings with participants, if needed. Files will be kept locked in a filing cabinet in an office, on site. The THPP has a Community Engagement Center/training center at this location for participants to utilize. All staff at the participant living unit will be fingerprint cleared prior to accepting any admissions. Background cleared staff will accompany all participants to the Community Engagement Center, located at the address listed above. LPA is waiting for the granted fire clearance from Hayward Fire Department. This facility is ready for licensure once the fire clearance is received and Licensing Program Manager (LPM), has reviewed and approved the application. LPA will notify you of licensure date and email facility license.

On 08/25/23 at 10:00 AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Alyssa Ng made an unannounced Post Licensing Inspection to Love Never Fails Administrative office. LPA met with Vanessa Russell, Administrator. At 10:15 AM, LPA did a walk through inspection with Administrator of the office. The office has sufficient space for confidential meetings, all participant files and staff files are located in a locked cabinet in a secure location. The agency has their license posted in their office. The office is in compliance with Community Care Licensing (CCL) regulations. LPA spoke with Administrator about the residential unit. Administrator stated that the residential units have all working toilets, sinks and tubs. Administrator notified LPA that the program provides all participants with household essentials. At 11:30 AM, LPA reviewed 1 participant file with Administrator. The participant was in the program for 2 days so there was insufficient information. LPA discussed the forms needed to be maintained in the client, staff, and the facility file. At 12:15 PM LPA observed 3 staff files to be complete, all documentation is up to date and all staff training were up to date/current. LPA Ng interviewed 2 staff. During inspection, LPA requested a updated copy of the LIC 500 Personnel Report to maintain their file current. A review of Licensing Information System on August 25th, 2023 indicates that all but one facility staff associated to the facility had DOJ, FBI and child abuse index check clearances. The facility have been in contact with Guardian regarding that one staff. Administrator assured me that the staff member who is not cleared have not been around any participants. Per Title 22 Regulations, 0 deficiencies were cited during this inspection. Exit interview conducted and a copy of the report was left at the facility.

On 5/7/2024 at 1:53 PM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Jasmine Cardeno and LPA Mona Lam made an unannounced visit to Love Never Fails Administrative Office to conduct a required annual inspection. The Facility Love Never Fails currently has no clients in care as of 5/7/2024. During the time of the inspection, there was 1 facility staff and 2 office staff members that were present. At 1:53 PM, LPA Cardeno met an office staff member (ITBIC Outreach and CEC Manager), Viviana Soto, and notified her that she will be conducting a required annual inspection for the THPP, and will need to meet with Facility Administrator, Vanessa Russell, on-site at the Love Never Fails Administrative Office. At 1:58 PM, LPA Cardeno contacted Facility Administrator, Vanessa Russell, via telephone call and left a voicemail message to let Vanessa Russell know that the Facility Administrator will need to meet at the office on-site in order to conduct the required annual inspection. At 2:13 PM, Vanessa Russell notified LPA Cardeno via text message, that she was on the way to Love Never Fails Administrative Office to meet with LPAs. At 2:54 PM, LPA Cardeno and LPA Lam met with Facility Administrator, Vanessa Russell, who helped facilitate the inspection and do a walk-through of the office. The Love Never Fails Office has sufficient space for confidential meetings and staff files are located in a locked cabinet in a secure location. The agency has their license posted in a prominent location in their office. The office is in compliance with Community Care Licensing (CCL) regulations. Vanessa Russell stated that the Love Never Fails Transitional Housing Placement Program currently does not have clients in care as of 5/7/2024. LPA Cardeno reviewed 1 staff file to be complete with all documentation being up to date and current. LPA Cardeno discussed the forms needed to be maintained in the facility files including the posting of the up to date Certificate of Compliance. LPA Cardeno conducted 1 staff interview. There were 0 deficiencies cited during this inspection. An exit interview was conducted, and a copy of the report was given to Facility Administrator, Vanessa Russell, whose signature on this from confirms the receipt.

On 5/22/2024 at 12:25 PM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Celeste Aparicio made an unannounced visit to Love Never Fails Administrative Office to conduct a required annual inspection. LPA met on site with office staff member ITBIZ Program Manager, Viviana Soto, and informed them on the purpose of the visit. LPA then spoke over the phone with Business Operations Manager/HR, Huda Alawi and Administrator Vanessa Russell who helped facilitate the inspection via telephone. During the inspection, Administrator Vanessa Russell stated that there are no current participants in the Love Never Fails Transitional Housing Placement Program (THPP). It was found that since being licensed the THPP has never had clients in care. The CARE Tool was used to conduct this inspection. LPA conducted a walk through of the Administrative office and observed sufficient space for confidential meetings and supplies. The agency has their license posted in a prominent location in their office. Using the CARE Tool LPA reviewed the Physical Plant, Operations, Staff Files, and Disaster Preparedness. Staff files are maintained electronically, LPA was able to view the staff files through a shared google document. LPA observed staff files to be complete and up to date. At this time, no deficiencies were observed or cited. An exit interview was conducted, and a copy of the report was given to ITBIZ Program Manager, Viviana Soto whose signature on this from confirms the receipt.

On 06/23/2021, at approximately 2 PM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Chad Cabigon attempted to conduct the Required Annual Inspection for this Transitional Housing Placement Program. LPA first contacted Vivi Smally over the phone to do a COVID-19 screening--Mrs. Smally was not at the program's office and stated that she was not available this day due to having personal appointments. LPA informed Mrs. Smally that the inspection will be re-attempted either by the end of this week or early next week. Mrs. Smally stated that the program currently has two clients. On 06/30/2021, starting at approximately 3 PM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) conducted an onsite Annual/Required inspection of this Transitional Housing Placement Program (THPP). LPA met with Office Administrator Vivi Smally in the program office located at the above address. Two client files, staff records, and the participant unit’s Certificate of Compliance were reviewed. Personnel criminal record clearances were also verified by LPA. A tour of the participant unit’s interior and exterior areas was conducted; this unit was a detached two-story single-family residence located at 1450 Oakwood Ave., Vallejo 94591. The THPP’s two non-minor ambulatory dependent clients are the only residents of this house, each having their own room. There is a full bathroom on the first floor, another full bathroom on the second floor, and a third en-suite full bathroom located in the master bedroom. All bathrooms were inspected and found to have toilets, sinks, and bathtubs or showers in working order. The refrigerator was stocked with perishable goods sufficient for at least three days. There was a landline telephone located in a common area. No indication of firearms or any other weapons were observed by LPA; the common areas, including the yards, were free from clutter, and the egresses were unobstructed. The house was equipped with appropriate furnishings and supplies. No citations were issued as a result of this inspection. Exit interview conducted; a copy of this report is being provided to Mary’s Help.
